TITLE: Corporations, trade groups gave over $8 million to GOP election objectors following Jan. 6 riot, new study shows
SUMMARY: After the Jan. 6 riot, corporations and trade groups combined to give over $8 million to Republican lawmakers who objected to the 2020 presidential election.

TITLE: Jury finds Jeffrey Epstein friend Ghislaine Maxwell guilty in sex crimes trial
SUMMARY: British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted Wednesday of luring teenage girls to be sexually abused by late sex criminal and financier Jeffrey Epstein.

TITLE: January will make or break voting-rights push as Senate is set to consider rules changes
SUMMARY: The Senate will try to pass the Freedom to Vote Act and will consider filibuster rule changes if the voting-rights bill fails, Chuck Schumer said.

TITLE: Subpoenas issued to Donald Trump Jr., Ivanka Trump in New York attorney general probe of ex-president's company
SUMMARY: New York Attorney General Letitia James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misstated the value of real estate assets for financial benefit.

TITLE: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot aims to avoid another Covid lockdown, but won't 'take that off the table' as omicron spreads
SUMMARY: Lightfoot's remarks came as Chicago starts requiring proof of Covid vaccination for most people to enter restaurants, bars, gyms and other indoor areas.

TITLE: As prices soar, Biden aims to help independent meatpackers compete with industry giants
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden blames meatpacking industry giants for the soaring price of beef and chicken. So he's helping smaller meat processors compete with them.

TITLE: Biden disapproval hits new high as voters give him bad grades on economy, new CNBC/Change poll says
SUMMARY: Biden's disapproval rating reached a new high in December as more voters signaled their unhappiness with his handling of the economy.

TITLE: Joe Manchin says he has had no talks about resurrecting Biden's Build Back Better plan
SUMMARY: Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has insisted Democrats will work until they pass the Build Back Better Act, despite Sen. Joe Manchin's opposition to the bill.

TITLE: Criminal charge against former NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo is dropped
SUMMARY: Andrew Cuomo resigned as New York governor after nearly a dozen women claimed the Democrat sexually harassed them. So far, he has escaped criminal charges.

TITLE: Sen. Tim Kaine among hundreds trapped overnight in D.C.-area traffic jam caused by snowstorm, deep freeze
SUMMARY: Other stranded drivers in Virginia were forced to turn off their cars to conserve gasoline, even as temperatures fell well below freezing overnight.

TITLE: Sen. Tim Kaine and hundreds of others have been stuck in traffic for more than a day due to D.C. winter storm
SUMMARY: Other stranded drivers in Virginia were forced to turn off their cars to conserve gasoline, even as temperatures fell well below freezing overnight.

TITLE: Trump cancels event planned for anniversary of Jan. 6 Capitol riot
SUMMARY: Trump said he was canceling the event due to "the total bias and dishonesty" of the media and the House committee investigating his role in the Jan. 6 riot.

TITLE: Jan. 6 panel seeks info from Fox News host Sean Hannity, reveals texts he sent Trump aides
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 invasion of the Capitol is seeking information and cooperation from Fox News opinion host Sean Hannity.

TITLE: Global supply chain pressures may have peaked, a new index suggests
SUMMARY: The Fed's new tool shows global supply chain pressures at dizzying levels right now, but suggests issues may have peaked.

TITLE: Kamala Harris aide leaves vice president's office for Capitol Hill on heels of other departures
SUMMARY: Another aide is leaving Vice President Kamala Harris' office soon after two other advisors departed late last year.

TITLE: Sen. Tim Kaine arrives in D.C. after being stuck in a winter storm traffic jam for 27 hours
SUMMARY: Other stranded drivers in Virginia were forced to turn off their cars to conserve gasoline, even as temperatures plunged below freezing overnight.

TITLE: MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell says his phone records were subpoenaed by House Jan. 6 committee
SUMMARY: MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell says his phone records have been subpoenaed by the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 riot at the Capitol.

TITLE: Trump friend Tom Barrack scheduled to go on trial in September for illegal United Arab Emirates lobbying case
SUMMARY: The investor Tom Barrack is accused of secretly trying to advance the UAE's interests during the presidency of his friend, Donald Trump.

TITLE: Ghislaine Maxwell lawyers seek new trial after juror tells media he was sexually abused
SUMMARY: The conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell for abetting the abuse of underage girls by Jeffrey Epstein could be in peril because of a juror's media interviews.

TITLE: One year after the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, here's where Justice Department and House investigations stand
SUMMARY: The pro-Trump riot has spurred a massive criminal investigation by the DOJ, a House select committee probe and a voter-rights legislative push by Democrats.

TITLE: 'You can't love your country only when you win': Biden urges Americans to defend the right to vote, condemns Trump election lies on Jan. 6 anniversary
SUMMARY: Biden in a fiery speech condemned the "web of lies" spread by former President Donald Trump, blaming him directly for fomenting the attack.

TITLE: Trump SPAC Digital World Acquisition Corp. stock rises after social media app sets target launch date
SUMMARY: The SPAC linked to former President Donald Trump has said financial regulators are investigating stock trading before a merger announcement.

TITLE: Biden administration defends vaccine mandates in Supreme Court arguments
SUMMARY: President Biden issued the rules before the omicron variant drove Covid infection rates to new highs around the country.

TITLE: Liberty Global stands by board member John Dick despite daughter's theft claims
SUMMARY: Liberty Global, the largest international TV and broadband company, is standing by embattled board member John W. Dick, saying he serves in good standing.

TITLE: U.S. unemployment rate falls in December but rises for Black women
SUMMARY: The unemployment rate fell in December for all U.S. workers except Black women.

TITLE: Biden touts strong December wage increases, brushes off weak job growth
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden said unemployment fell more sharply in 2021 than any prior year in U.S. history.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia hires PR veteran and former Katie Couric producer for media consulting
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia hired public relations veteran Nicolla Hewitt as a freelance media consultant.

TITLE: Supreme Court conservatives sound skeptical of Biden's Covid vaccine-or-test rules
SUMMARY: President Biden issued the rules before the omicron variant drove Covid infection rates to new highs around the country.

TITLE: Criminal groping case against ex-New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo formally dismissed
SUMMARY: Andrew Cuomo, a Democrat, resigned last summer after nearly a dozen women said the then-New York governor sexually harassed them.

TITLE: With Republicans absent, Liz and Dick Cheney join Democrats to mark Jan. 6 attack anniversary
SUMMARY: As Democrats held events around the Capitol to mark the first anniversary of the Jan. 6 attack, Republicans were absent.

TITLE: Biden's first State of the Union address set for March 1
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden, whose Democratic Party controls both chambers of Congress, was invited to give the annual State of the Union address in March.
